FuncDef:
The dhcp check-client-packet loose layer2-subscriber dest-ip command configures the device to perform loose check on the destination IP addresses of packets in Layer 2 access. Specifically, the device is allowed to process unicast packets in Layer 2 access.
The undo dhcp check-client-packet loose layer2-subscriber dest-ip command disables loose check on the destination IP addresses of packets in Layer 2 access.
By default, the device does not perform loose check on the destination IP addresses of packets in Layer 2 access.
CLIs: undo dhcp check-client-packet loose layer2-subscriber dest-ip
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, the device does not perform loose check on the destination IP addresses of packets in Layer 2 access and discards unicast packets in Layer 2 access. To allow the device to process unicast packets in Layer 2 access, run the dhcp check-client-packet loose layer2-subscriber dest-ip command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
